review.title: Cockroach in this hotel!
review.reviewText: Checked in, walked into my room, set my bags down, walked into the restroom & found a cockroach crawling on the floor. Picked up my bag & went downstairs & asked to be checked out due to infestation. The desk clerk whom was also doing laundry, said she would go check the room & be right back. When she came back she said there was no cockroach & the room simply "smelled". To which I replied the bug was dead in the waste basket & I'd like to be checked out. She offered me another room & asked if I'd accept or not. Why would I want to stay there?! She refused to check me out. I decided it wasn't worth trying to speak with her & just leave & called expedia to see if they could set me up with another hotel (mind you with was past midnight in California). After 1 hour on hold & being transferred to 4 people they were not able to do anything for me. I ended up finding a Hyatt nearby & staying there for my weekend.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. I am pleased you were able to enjoy your stay and you found our location simple, yet convenient. Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

review.title: easy access
review.reviewText:
Fairly quiet and easy to get in and out
Friendly staff and nice room
review.negativeRemarks: directions to the lobby, for first-time visitors

review.reviewText: The buildings a bit old. It was over priced. We booked thru Expedia for the first time what a mistake. They charged our credit card a higher amount than we saw it on line and were told at the time of booking they owed us a refund which we never saw.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. I am glad you found our location suitable.  It is disappointing that our grab-and-go breakfast was not to your liking; however, I am pleased you favored the room comfortable and stay restful. Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

review.title: Good hotel in convenient location.
review.reviewText: Positives;  Location, room size, staff, quiet.  Negatives:  No business center printer (reception one bad quality), no in-room coffee, weak "breakfast."

review.title: Serviceable but pricy for what you get.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was not horrible,  did not smell bad, shower worked. Windows were tricky to open. Fridge had a loud hum all night and it's 10 feet from the bed. Expressway noise is constant ... it's only a few yards from the 101.  There is at least one giant hole in the wall by the elevator control ... not cut cleanly, but like someone punched through it in frustration. No attempt to repair it during the week I was there. 

One morning I came down and there were people who had been waiting over an hour for a  human to show up at the desk. Its was a ghost town, no people whatsoever servicing the hotel that morning. 

Free coffee + fruit in the morning .. and it's not bad.
review.locationRemarks: It's in the middle of an industrial wasteland, however you can drive to an air museum, or 50 minutes or so to downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Horrible experience
review.reviewText: Breakfast should really be updated to snacks and when asked if they could at least vacuum they said no because they come clean every 8 days which I can understand with being an extended stay but really you can make time to clean up at the request of a guest.
They don't clean your room for a week. Apparently those are the hotel policies.

review.title: Horrible Staff
review.reviewText: Arrived at 355pm one of my rooms was not ready, the front desk guy was rude and told me that he would let us know and it would be ready soon, we asked for it 3x and they finally gave us the room at 7pm..the stove did not work, it was dirty under the bed and when I called to ask for a toaster they made me go pick it up.

review.title: Nice hotel free lite up parking
review.reviewText: Very nice kid friendly the continental breakfast could use some improving

review.title: Did not have my reservation
review.reviewText: Made reservation through Expedia, drove up from LA and got there around 1am. Desk attendant did not have my reservation on file and had to call Expedia to fax it. After the call and the fax I was given a room, which, when I opened it had other people occupying it. Returned to the front desk and was told there were no rooms available after all and nothing they could do for me. Stranded in Sf after that and almost had to sleep in my car. Thankfully a friend helped me out.
Rooms were simple. But it didn't accommodate all basic amenities. Soap bars were not available for all members. Overall it was ok for a night stay. Should not expect much from it.

review.title: Ok for business people but not for short stays.
review.reviewText: Bathroom had hairs in shower from previous guest.Shower curtain not long enough flooding water on floor.Needed towels to wipe up.No guest computer available,had to have front desk print up my boarding passes which took longer.Carpet not well vacuumed & maid service once a week.If you want more room service  you have to pay extra.

review.title: Extended Stay
review.reviewText: It was OK, if I was going to stay for more than one day I would probably choose another hotel with nicer facilities and better breakfast choices
review.locationRemarks: Breakfast spot was nearby, it was close to what I needed to do in Belmont and there are plenty of places to eat nearby

review.title: Overpriced Hostel
review.reviewText:
the all package was lousy. Kitchen with no tools , poor shower, no cleaning service all week... lousy breakfast...
but prices very close to regular - good 3 stars hotel...
review.negativeRemarks: almost evrything

review.title: Traffic Noise.
review.reviewText: Should have asked to change rooms but I thought the traffic noise would lessen or I would  get used to it. NO. Also no "pet area" outside or at least none that I found. If pets are permitted, then a pet area should be readily accessible. Also noisy ventilation system.

review.title: Breakfast was a joke
review.reviewText: The room has a kitchen which is good for longer stays. But the breakfast was the worst I've had (pack of oatmeal with water)! I would be better off and come prepared if they had no breakfast at all.
Overall experience of stay was OK. Should have gone for daily house keeping as the room becomes untidy after 2 days.

review.title: One night for business trip
review.reviewText: Room was clean and quiet. No complaints. I did end up with a Ada room where everything was low and open. But I booked last minute and didn't mind at all.

review.title: Hotel from he!!
review.reviewText:
Staff was rude. We asked for more pillows after calling back and begging for them they brought up a couple dirty ones. Someone elses make up on pillow. 

Pubic hairs on "fresh" towels
Very rude staf . Don't even know their own policy

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Had an amazing time  the Hotle was wonderful!! The staff were  very friendly and  I would  go back to that hotel Again  !!!!

review.title: Good value for the money.
review.reviewText: Room was comfortable and quiet, and the rate was reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: The towels!  Really, they were just awful!

review.title: Nice hotel and very close to the SF Airport
review.reviewText: Easy to get to and easy to get back on the freeway to either the SF Airport or to go north to the City itself.  This is a simple hotel... do not expect fancy amenities.  We also felt very safe there.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the San Francisco Airport and we felt secure.
review.negativeRemarks: Keep doing what you are doing.  Simple and convenient.

review.title: Looks good but hotel staff needs work.
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are very nice but the hotel staff we encountered when we stayed there are not so great.  When we were checking in two staff members were talking badly about another staff member in front of us.....our room had a problem that was not our doing and my husband went down to talk to the person at the front desk and he said there was nothing he could do about it and it was something that needed to be fixed right away....wouldn't change rooms for us or even attempt to help and after much talking too he finally called the manager and it got done but we had to fix the problem.  I am not writing all staff is bad just the ones we encountered but not to help a hotel guest with a problem in the room is just terrible customer service.  Breakfast is only muffins and granola bars.
Staff was rude. Computers didn't work.  Staff was rude. Couldn't check in on time.
review.negativeRemarks: Better management

review.reviewText: Nice stuff we check in early at 12:00 pm , clean room

review.title: bad smell /dirty
review.reviewText: Poor oder thought the hotel and my room actually smelled very bad  / sheets and bedding poor.

review.title: It's OK
review.reviewText: Courteous staff. Would use Extended America on my next trip again.

review.title: The optimum in price performance
review.reviewText: This hotel would easily get the same rating at double the room rate. Very clean, furnishings in good shape. Staff accommodating to help find a quiet room. Hotel surprising quiet. Stayed two nights.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast very minimalist, gets the job done, barely.

review.reviewText: I was in SF for a day and needed a hotel near the airport last minute. The photos for this hotel are a little deceiving. When we got there the room smelled like smoke (it was a non smoking room) and the bath towels looked dirty. I found small hairs in the bath towels also, I used my own from home. Also the shower water never got warm. The bed was not the best but was doable. Definitely worth the extra money to stay somewhere else.

review.title: Middle of nowhere..
review.reviewText: Terrible breakfast with nothing close by to go to for breakfast..
review.negativeRemarks: better breakfast..

review.title: Very friendly motel
review.reviewText: We were most appreciative to a young man by the name of Rony who worked behind the desk. He was very friendly and made us feel right at home even tho this was a motel not a home.  I have never stayed at a motel where I was made to feel so welcome. This young man needs to train others on his manner!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean, very quiet.

review.reviewText: Room had not been cleaned and smelled like cigarettes

review.title: Clean and Convenient
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at this hotel several times. We visit the Bay area to see our granddaughter and this is a convenient location for us as our daughter lives in South San Mateo.

Hotel has always been clean and has basic facilities.  No gym or pool.  Room is clean and I like to cook so having a full sized refrigerator and kitchen is a plus.  I always bring my own non stick fry pan but they do provide a pan and pot and enough dishes for 2 people.  There is a Vons close by and Trader Joes and Whole Foods are not too far away.

We had a couple issues with the room this time, told the front desk about them, and they were fixed by the time we returned later the same day.

The worst thing about all the rooms we have stayed in, is the interior temperature.  The rooms are always hot!  This time it was winter and the outside temperature was in the low 50's at night but the room was 74 degrees.  We had to keep the windows open so as not to use the air conditioning.  The freeway is close so that makes the road noise louder but it did not keep us awake.  When we have stayed in the hotel in summer, we had to run the A/C all the time because the temperature inside the room was unbearable.  Evidently, there is no insulation in this hotel.

For some reason the prices keep going up on the rooms and have risen a lot in the 1 1/2 years we have been coming here.  We used to get a room for just over $100 a night but now the rooms are in the mid to high $100's.
review.negativeRemarks: Temperature in rooms.  Windows very hard to open. Morning "Grab & Go" breakfast used to have fruit each day, now it is muffins.
review.locationRemarks: Location is close to the freeway but may be too far if planning to drive to SF each day.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Our fourth time staying here...each time the hotel gets progressively worse.....it's is not as clean as before, hallways are not vacuumed, my room smelled like some cheap cologne, the kitchen supplies are old. phone didn't work, garage door handle was broken, wasn't fixed during our 5-day stay. Probably won't stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: It's like staying in an apartment. Full kitchen and very spacious. Probably stay at another location.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance and upkeep of the hotel is badly needed. Has really rundown in the last few years.

review.reviewText:
Good place stay with a kid. 
There was a kitchen, but no pot and pans. It was a optional amenity. Please check with them with hotel if you need them.

review.title: Very basic hotel but nice to have kitchen.
review.reviewText: Decent, very basic, no frills. Ventilation in the bathroom was very loud so a bit noisy if you are a light sleeper. Only stayed one night before flying home. Grab and go breakfast was a nice gesture. Low on towels but I'm sure more would be available if requested.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff seemed a bit sparse. It is what it is. No frills.

review.title: Awful check in.
review.reviewText: Husband waited at the empty desk for 10 minutes before being told they were full while I unknowingly booked a room on the phone in the car. Went in and waited for at least 10 more minutes at the empty desk with a lobby full of waiting guests. Got checked in. Key didn't work in the door. Had to go back down to get help. At least we got a room! A party who had booked 3 rooms was told they could have one for all 6 adults and 4 children.

review.title: Just Normal Long Term type of Hotel. Nothing spec
review.reviewText: Location, little too quite, particurarly in the night. At lobby only one staff.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: We were thankful for excellent hotel management. Location was convenient for our needs. Price was very competitive.
review.negativeRemarks: We were bothered by noises from the room above; sounded like the bathroom fan all night?
review.locationRemarks: We took day-trips into San Francisco, Point Reyes, and Half Moon Bay.

review.title: Distance
review.reviewText: It's very far away from the Caltrain station if you are walking it. You'll have to walk on the freeway. Not a problem if you have your own vehicle! Nice staff. Very good for a budget stay!

review.title: Nice For The Price
review.reviewText: Very Nice For The Price. The Room Was Clean And The Hotel Looks Like It Is Kept Nice.

review.title: Good for an overnighter
review.reviewText: This hotel was good for the 1 night we stayed. Clean but small for 4. It was quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Its too far from everything, nothing to do close by
review.locationRemarks: Not so good location and nothing to do near by

review.title: Very Clean! Served its purpose
review.reviewText: Clean and newly remodeled. No issues whatsoever.

review.title: so Hungry!
review.reviewText: we were expecting a continental breakfast,not much but something.When I went downstairs to the serving area , I found the coffee, but the grab and go breakfast was only an orange. I asked the desk man where s the breakfast he told me the delivery was not made therefore no breakfast. How hard is is to run to the store to pick up some muffins. last time at this hotel ,Thanks anyway .

review.title: Helpful Staff
review.reviewText: We booked a room online - needing 2 beds. When we got up to the room, there was only one. The clerk was very helpful in ensuring we got the accommodations we needed. Also, we left in a hurry and forgot some items in the room. We were able to call the hotel and pick up our property the next day. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText: Ill go some we're else next time. I did not care for the room

review.title: Convenient.
review.reviewText: Easy access from freeway although the city needs to replace the road.
review.negativeRemarks: Continental breakfast needs much improvement

review.title: For $198/night it was a rip-off.
review.reviewText: Did not expect no frills at all for the price we paid. The rooms did not feel clean at all despite having "just been cleaned" and actually found a Q-tip under the blanket. When I mentioned this to the Front Desk, they simply asked if we would like to change rooms (no apologies) but that we would have to wait (past the 2pm officially published checkin time). Peeping into the room number that was newly assigned, I spoke to the male cleaner and casually mentioned that our next door room was quite dirty and could he kindly see to it that this wouldn't happen for what he was working on just then. It was, just without the Q-tip this time. There is a hair dryer but you have to go all the way down to the Front Desk to pick it up. Overall had a very dingy feel to it. Am never returning
review.positiveRemarks: Chose it for the location and was a fallback because our favorite hotel was booked solid
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness! Service training for the Front Desk. They were very unattached from the job.
review.locationRemarks: Oracle HQ, Bridgepointe Parkway for shopping

review.title: it was Ok...
review.reviewText:
the hotel is "OK"... but the commercial makes it seem better then what it really is.
but over all the hotel was OK not the best but i might stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast was lame / no pool / too far from san fran / no shuttle / no place to eat near by
review.locationRemarks: location was good for a business trip but not for a family trip.

review.title: More apartment than Hotel
review.reviewText:
New concept for hotels ...very basic self service. No maid service as standard, so no linen change or room cleaning during duration of stay. Quite expensive for quality of hotel/ more Apartment.
There was a kitchenette with two ring hob , microwave, kettle, sink, coffee maker and refrigerator.
review.negativeRemarks: No maid service
review.locationRemarks: 50 mins by car to SF centre, 30 mins walk to 'Caltrain' Station. Parking in SF $45-$60 a day. Use the Caltrain !

review.title: Nothing fancy, but clean and felt new.
review.reviewText:
Spent a week here. No room service if you are staying 7 days or less. You can have your room cleaned for ten bucks per request i think.. Avgerage place, my room was nice and clean. Fridge, 2 burners, and microwave. Minimal stuff, but it will get you by if your by yourself.
Priced fair, considering how much more expensive other hotels have become in the area. Staff was nice, decent parking. Never had a problem getting a close parking spot. No breakfast, only coffee, fruit, instant oatmeal.

All in all, it was an OK place, no frills, but simple and OK... Nothing really negitive to say about it except the TV remote didnt work, and they only offered minimal channels, no local sports (A's Giants, Sharks, which really sucked- but they did have Showtime however). For the price, I would consider staying there again.
review.negativeRemarks: TV channels were minimal
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to almost everything you need. Food, freeway, etc...

review.title: avoid
review.reviewText: very loud ventilation, neighbors' sounds carry through walls, odors, tv screen aspect ratio wrong and unchangeable, "breakfast" a misnomer. why does this place get 2.5 stars? overpriced at 40 percent discount.

review.title: Good for a lower price.
review.reviewText:
It is just a reasonable hotel but not for the price of ~ $ 170. The location is isolated unless it is a location near your even that makes you restricted to few options.

I would pay $60 per night for this.

Breakfast is nothing near what a breakfast should be.
Hallways have smell of garbage room.
The check in time is 3 PM. When we got there, they were asking us to wait another 45 minutes for the room to get ready. We were unable to manage and they gave us another room that I assume was worse than what we had booked.

review.title: Ok not great
review.reviewText:
I have stayed here many times. I am disappointed that they discontinued the breakfast. The "grab & go" breakfast they advertise consists of pkg. muffins and unappealing fruit.

Rooms OK, nice to have a kitchen, which is why I stay there. No housekeeping if you are staying 5-6 days. You can ask for more towels. All in all it is OK, considering the prices in the
SF Bay Area.
review.negativeRemarks: No breakfast and minimal housekeeping
review.locationRemarks: Great location for SF and Silicon valley. Righ in the center of the SF Peninsula. Easy freeway access.

review.title: Business traveler
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and the room both comfortable and roomy. The area was dominated by office buildings and the highway, but it was convenient to my business meetings. When checking in, the front desk help was extremely courteous and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a "pretty" area.

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: I had stayed at this hotel 6 months ago and conditions were far better. On this trip (2 nights), I found my room on the 5th floor was not properly cleaned (ex: hair in the bathtub, soiled seat) etc.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness

review.title: Satisfactory Long-Term Crash Pad
review.reviewText: Hotels on the peninsula cal into two general categories: expensive ($150+) big name chains and dumpy dive motels on the El Camino. The Extended Stay is priced competitively with the dives, but is a step above in quality. I recently stayed here for a week while working in the area - and it was handy to have a kitchenette to reheat leftovers and make coffee.
review.negativeRemarks: Next to freeway, guests seem like they were just kicked out of their homes, no bar or restaurant.

review.title: Okay for convenience to SFO airport
review.reviewText: We were given a handicap room, even though we did not request it. There was no counter space in the bathroom, which was inconvient. The grab and go breakfast was very limited-only coffee, no juice. Location was convenient to the SFO airport.

review.title: Yappy dog
review.reviewText: Didn't know that, they had became pet friendly since my last stay. So the slight noise in my room kept the dog yappying through out the night. But wasn't enough to break my jet lag sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: TV programming, and pillows on beds
review.locationRemarks: A great location for me for what I need to do when I come to town.

review.title: learn/teach customer service and hire new staff
review.reviewText:
Staff was rude and told us wd had no reservation.....
Made me charge my phone and show a confirmation number when it clearly should have been in their system. Argued with me and didn't do anything to fix their own mistake.

review.title: Great hotel for family and biz travellers.
review.reviewText: I stayed on the 3rd floor and the room was completely renovated. Nice pics on the walls, cleanliness was top notch. Didn't partake in the grab and go breaky but honestly couldnt care less about that. Marble countertops in the bathroom, nice shower and really chic wood floors. Full kitchen but didn't use it except the fridge. Now that I know about this place I would not hesitate to book again (but hopefully at a lower rate next time). They even offer you a delivery menu if you choose to order in.
review.positiveRemarks: The new and stylish decor and convenient locale to freeway.
review.negativeRemarks: It's an Extended Stay property, I wasnt expecting anything lofty so I wasnt disappointed!
review.locationRemarks: 10 mins from SFO, right off the freeway so easy access back to airport.

review.title: Great for family stay.
review.reviewText: Stay was good. Nicely located new stores and eateries.

review.title: Great weekend retreat
review.reviewText: Great hotel customer service was implacable; rooms were need and all the amenities in their proper place would certianly recommend again and again.

review.title: Basic accomodations
review.reviewText: Basic, decent accomodations. Grab'n'Go breakfast is just coffee and instant oatmeal, which was gone by the time we came down.
review.negativeRemarks: Feathers kept sticking out of the pillows.

review.title: I would not recommend this place
review.reviewText:
Checked in and the room key didn't work. Got a replacement which didn't work either. This was lucky because the room was occupied by someone else. Awkward!!!

There was an irritating blinking light on the smoke alarm. Maybe they had a problem with people smoking in the the rooms because there was a cage installed over the alarm which reflected the light like a disco ball.

The grab-and-go breakfast bar had no coffee, two oranges and some packets of instant oatmeal. We grabbed the oranges and didn't wait around.

review.title: Recent business trip.
review.reviewText: The breakfast choice and coffee was undesireable. But everything else was superb.

review.title: Clean and quiet
review.reviewText: Very clean and quiet, I was pleasantly surprised.The hotel is the right choice for anyone that would like to keep to themselves, do their own grocery shopping instead of going out to restaurants in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: very clean - from the bathroom to the kitchenette.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish there was a place to get just coffee in the morning. There was one bag in the room for the first day only.
review.locationRemarks: It was convenient for me - walking distance to the office.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: The hotel room is clean and comfortable. I can do some simple cooking. Overall, I am happy with staying at the hotel.

review.title: Good but not Great
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel but don't forget this is an extended stay. So you are not going to get the same level of service that you might expect at other hotels. But in terms of the basics.... clean room, sheets, people, and service they get the job done. Plus i think the location is nice but its is outside the city of San Francisco by a good 15 miles which can be an hour drive with traffic.

review.title: On balance well worth the price
review.reviewText: Room was well appointed and included kitchen - dishes, microwave and stove, full size fridge. This chain has less emphasis on daily housekeeping (though it's available as an option), and the prices reflect it. Doesn't include bkfst, but I've never found the ones that do to be very good in the US. Only other drawback - no computer terminal in lobby. Alll in all, not bad.

review.title: Served its purpose
review.reviewText:
Overall the hotel expected as performed. Having said that I found two faults with the room.

1) Many of the dishes which were supposedly clean looked as if they had been wiped once with a dirty rag and placed back in the room.

2) Neither employee could figure out the simple task of printing off of a USB stick. Yes you might be thinking it was some fancy memory stick that was at fault but I am both a computer engineer and a frequent traveller and I purposely travel with the simplist USB stick that is readable by almost all makes and models of computers.

The price could have been a bit better considering it was right next the 101 highway but sound insulation in the room was adequate to prevent much of seeping in from the 101. On the other hand the air conditioning unit could have been a few dBs quiter while in operation.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel room is clean; kitchen is convenient to use;

review.title: Just what we needed
review.reviewText:
My girlfriend and I needed a place to stay while visiting San Francisco. We have stayed in Extended Stay Hotels before & knew we liked it, AND knew what to expect (compared to other places we looked at which we had never been to before).
This chain of hotels may not be the classiest BUT its always the best bang for your buck! The rooms go for the usual going-rate for most no-frills hotels, BUT you get a KITCHEN with it! Microwave, sink, FULL SIZE FRIDGE! ...
My girlfriend was sad to see there was not a hairdryer (seems pretty standard these days, no? ...plus i got heat for it since I told her NOT to bring hers because "all hotels have them these days honey")
Bed comfort is not top notch, but was fine for our 5 night stay (tip- ask for extra pillows & blankets!)
All the staff we encountered were friendly and kind.
And last but not least, although this may be a BAD thing to some...it was the ONLY hotel we found that still offered SMOKING ROOMS!
The location is near a highway, so you hear cars, but nothing too crazy, and its only a quick 20 min trip to San Fran.
Yay for Extended Stay!

review.title: Cheap hotel near San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice and cheap hotel near San Francisco, room was ok, they gave us free wireless connection. They do not have ice machine.

review.title: Extended Stay Belmont
review.reviewText: The room was clean and nice. I have stayed at this place before and it's always a go experience.

review.title: Very poor maintanance,quality going way down, 2 days no lights in bath, dirty chair, , general decli
review.reviewText: Very poor maintanence, dirty chair, no lights 2 days in bath, tho reported to desk, no luggage cart to move out, much decline since I first staid there. I WAS a repeat customer. Not again.

review.title: Good price!
review.reviewText: The room was clean, and the amenities were better than expected, but the vending machine was empty and apparently there was no ice machine-we were expected to "go to the corner gas station" for ice, or use the ice cube tray in the freezer. Otherwise, it was a lovely stay!

review.title: will use this hotel on a regular basis
review.reviewText: great place for a very reasonable price

review.title: Extended stay expectations
review.reviewText: While your hotel was comfortable and clean, I did not expect that there wouldn't be dish soap available and that my garbage wouldn't be emptied for 4 days. I understand the concept of 'extended stay', but I was only there for 4 days; as such, I think it would be a good idea to look at travelers who are not staying for long periods of time and treat them a little differently...provide dish soap, coffee filters and garbage service.

review.title: Good value and convenient
review.reviewText: The check-in was smooth and very helpful. Spacious room, good amenities. A smell of smoke in the air and bed was the only detraction from a good experience.

review.title: Okay for the price
review.reviewText: The employees were courteous and polite. the room was adequate for my needs, since I was traveling with my small dog. the kitchenette with the refrigerator, sink, microwave, two burner cooktop helped us to be very comfortable.

review.title: will definitely go back
review.reviewText: i was surprised that it was really a good deal for the price. our room was very clean. the full kitchenette was a good addition. cant wait to go back.

review.title: Smelly
review.reviewText: The hotel smell from the elevator to my room. Thank goodness the smell did not penetrate the room and I have horrible smelling senses. Not sure why management does not have any air freshners.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel guest service was lackluster. Room was not prepared at time of arrival. Late check out was not available. Service agent was less than interested in doing his job. Reservation was not available upon check out. No amenities available.

review.title: The right place for an extended stay
review.reviewText: The room was really a studio apartment, complete with small, but fully functional kitchen. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was well-maintained. The basic price includes local telephone and cable TV, but not wireless Internet, which is available for an additional fee. Lacking a restaurant, bar, or any shops, this hotel isn't for luxury travel, but would be ideal for a lengthier stay where you plan to cook your own meals.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: On the outside this hotel looks like a standard hotel. On the inside it's a cross between a dorm room and an industrial building. The room was a horrible mish mash of worn clashing fabrics, the sheets had tears in them, the blanket was like a piece of paper. The countertops in the kitchenette were peeling off. It was depressing and overpriced.
